chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan Bradley Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan Bradley Anderson was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Ryan Bradley Anderson was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

146 days jail credit if revoked.

records.addlTxt: Discharge Certificate rec'd via fax from DOC

Discharge Certificate.   Effective March 21, 2019, discharged from judgment only.
Civil rights restored:  1)Right to Vote.  2)Obligations for jury duty.
Civil rights not restored:  1)Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is received from the governer.  2)Public office can not be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.
Correspondence from DOC verifying defendant paid CO Obs in full.
Probation review hearing on January 7, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in custody.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received PSI, no corrections.  State disagrees slightly with recommendation, recommends 12 mos. jail followed by 3 yrs. probation and consider time in Exodus House as credit for jail with conditions probation recommnded in PSI.  Defense counsel in support of PSI.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation w/conditions; immediately enter into and remain compliant with the Eau Claire Drug Court Program; 146 days credit.
Letter from Atty Bahnson with 7 letters of support for Mr. Anderson.
Sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court agreement reached.  Defendant will accept State's offer, State move to amend count 1 to simple possession 2nd & subsequent, count 2 defendant will plead to as charged, State move to dismiss counts 3, 4, 5, request PSI.  Statute 961.41(3g)(g) as repeater.  Subject to negotiations court amends count 1, count 2 remains as filed.  To count 1 possess meth as repeater defendant pleads no contest; count 2 as repeater, defendant pleads no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done K&V, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty, dismiss counts 3, 4,5, order PSI.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 60 days out.
Status conference at 01-19-2016 10:15 am

Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter remains unresolved, request another scheduling conference.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Status conference at 12-14-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, and constitutional rights.  NGP entered.  Referred to scheduling clerk.  Any conditions of bond cont'd.

Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called & Sworn by State, Chief Deputy Greg Balow.  Cross-exam by Atty Bahnson.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over.  State files Information with the court.
Preliminary hearing at 11-09-2015 10:30 am
G.S.B. is required to appear on 11/09/2015 at 10:30 am
G.S.B. is required to appear on 09/21/2015 at 9:00 am
Preliminary hearing at 09-21-2015 09:00 am

Court modifies bond to allow defendant to be released into an inpatient residential treatment facility.  If defendant is kicked out of the program or walks away from the program, he must return to jail.

Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in custody.  Atty Bahnson requests modification of bond to $1000 Sign. Bond as his PO Agent put in a referral for him to the Fahrman Center.  Court will modify bond to allow defendant to be released into inpatient residential treatment facility.  If defendant is kicked out of the treatment program or walks away from the program, he must return to jail.  WTL for PH cont'd.  Defendant not being revoked, ATR.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Atty Erika Bahnson appt'd.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court with attorney Patrick William Waters of SPD.  Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received complaint, waives reading.  Notes defendant on PO hold and PO agent looking @ ATR, requests cash bond be lowered to $250.  Court leaves bond as set, counsel can request to modify if he gets into an ATR program.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan Bradley Anderson in court, in custody on PO hold.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights including right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $1000 cash bond.  Court sets bond at $1000 cash, informs the defendant to contact the SPD Office and continues matter to tom.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
